noun.description: Tannaitic material which is not incorporated in the Mishnah.

origin: Late 19th century; earliest use found in The Jewish Quarterly Review. From post-biblical Hebrew bāraiṯā and its etymon Aramaic barrāyĕṯā, lit. external (material), short for maṯnīṯā barrāyĕṯā (emphatic form) external Mishnah from maṯnīṯā Mishnah + bāraiṯā external.
